#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Choose Your Niche in Art
#Text=Do you want a niche ( a specialty ) to do what you do in art , creating your own style of art for fun or profit .
#Text=Be a critic of your own art and try ( to you ) new ideas .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Find a place to do your chosen art specialty .
#Text=Make sure it 's away from anything that could get damaged by your materials .
#Text=A backyard or an empty basement are good places to consider .
#Text=Choose your niche in a medium .
#Text=Pick the method and materials that you work well with or want to master or express .
#Text=Artists use many kinds of materials to create totally different kinds of artwork .
#Text=Some are :
#Text=Paint .
#Text=Acrylic and oil-based are all good options .
#Text=Pencils .
#Text=Artists pencils are sold in sets and individually , and come in many different thicknesses for darker or lighter lines .
#Text=Clay .
#Text=Crayons brand children 's clay comes in many textures and colors , and air dries .
#Text=You may want to begin with that , if you are new to sculpting .
#Text=But professional clay comes in more hues and bakes hard in the oven .
#Text=Yarn , string and thread .
#Text=Knitting , crocheting , and embroidery are often considered crafts and not really art , but they teach many useful skills and are just as " real " as painting and sculpting .
#Text=Ink .
#Text=Black ink
#Text=line drawing requires dots , hashes or washes ( watered down ink applied with a brush ) for shading and tones .
#Text=Watercolor .
#Text=This medium is a special cross between painting and drawing , using color washes .
#Text=Chalk .
#Text=Pastels are something like watercolor ( but dry ) .
#Text=Charcoal is a variation of drawing with chalk .
#Text=Commercial art .
#Text=Illustrations , in books , cartoons , comics , plus animation , maps , technical drawing ( and writing ) etc. are good ideas .
#Text=Computer assisted .
#Text=Digital art .
#Text=Use art programs .
#Text=Choose to build-art or make art-prints .
#Text=Some people may consider some of these as crafts , or " artsy stuff " , but that would be a matter of opinion :
#Text=Sheet metal .

#Text=You can hammer copper relief similar to landscapes or steel to form shapes or bend and/or cut shapes and attach metal parts together for framed wall display or as mobiles ( with moving parts ) .
#Text=Found objects .
#Text=Buttons and bottle caps ( odds and ends/pieces off machines , etc. ) are great to use in several kinds of modern art .
#Text=Weld or braze metal rods , tubes and cut and shape pieces of sheet copper or brass to make art such as butterflies , trees , and town scenes , and such .
#Text=Wooden .
#Text=Carve and cut sculpture in wood .
#Text=Silk screen .
#Text=Create limited prints to sale ( even art-Tee shirts as for musical bands ) .
#Text=Lithographs or art-prints .
#Text=Draw and paint on smooth marble sheet ; then dampen the area with a special solution and apply ink with a roller .
#Text=The moist stone repels greasy ink .
#Text=Paper is rolled with a drum to transfer the inked image , etc.
#Text=Linoleum art-prints .
#Text=Cut and peal away non-image .
#Text=Ink is applied , and print onto paper by roller pressure .
#Text=Learn/Create your own technique .
#Text=Not everyone is a great painter naturally .
#Text=You may need to learn how to correctly mix paint colors or how to draw the human body proportionally .
#Text=Look around at community colleges and craft stores for public lessons in whatever skill you want to improve .
#Text=Find your niche by getting inspired in art .
#Text=Ideas for great works of art come in many forms .
#Text=Magazines , old movies , buildings , and landscapes are all great places to look for examples .
#Text=But your own thoughts are also creative .
#Text=Draw from your own feelings , experiences , and dreams .
#Text=Video
#Text=Tips
#Text=Some places to shop for materials are Dick Blick , Michaels , and Joann Fabrics
#Text=Listening to music is a great way to have a lot of fun while painting or drawing !
#Text=Online product reviews give lots of great information about many different materials .
#Text=Read them to make sure you are getting the right materials for your project .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Read the directions for use on the product you buy thoroughly !
#Text=Use a drop cloth ( either plastic or fabric that wo n't be used for anything else ) whenever you are using anything messy .
#Text=Related wikiHow
#Text=How to Become an Artist
